name: UXFolio Case Study Template
description:
Draft, organize, and experiment with your document’s structure more rapidly in Figma before publishing final work to UXFolio.


This template allows you to quickly drag around UXFolio layouts like building blocks and use certain native Figma functionality not currently available directly on the UXFolio site, including...

  • Zooming out to see your entire document
  • Including screencaps of other case studies next to your draft as reference points
  • Quickly undoing and redoing changes to layout and content order
  • Trying out different layout selections without losing your draft content


Other features in this template include the ability to...

  • Re-order content by dragging sections directly up and down in the document
  • Use text-based placeholders in image frames to jot down content ideas
  • Apply a “Draft” effect to distinguish between draft vs final content
  • Adjust sizing and cropping for image content (or create new content in context) that can be exported as assets for the site


The template uses Auto Layout & Variants to accurately recreate UXFolio’s layouts & customization options so you can rapidly experiment without worrying about feasibility on the actual site.


In this latest update, you can now paste images directly into the layout templates! I've also fixed some Variant bugs, tried to make instructional text appear in smaller more context-sensitive chunks, and incorporated a slew of other improvements based on feedback!
